defs: the condition or fact of being indebted to one's teacher, preceptor or religious pontiff.

to explain or detail one's characteristics; to indicate the distinctive feature or features of.
to mark with (a sign, symbol or indication).
to be aware of as something or someone known before or as the same as that known; to recognise.
to recognise as being or show to be the very person or thing known, described or claimed; fix the identity of; to identify.
to set down in writing; make a note of; to note.
to acknowledge the existence, worth or genuineness of; to appreciate.

a visible trace or impression on a surface; a mark - a) a line, dot or other distinctive feature produced by drawing, colouring, stamping, etc. b) a spot, stain, scratch, blemish, mar, bruise, dent, etc.

a sign, symbol or indication - a) a printed or written sign or stroke; b) a brand, label, seal, tag, etc. put on an article to show the owner, maker, etc; c) a sign or indication of some quality, character, etc. d) a cross or other sign made on a document as a substitute for a signature by a person unable to write.
knowledge (of something) got from personal experience or study of it; the state or relation of being acquainted (with someone); acquaintance.
the state of being famous; renown; fame.
a mark or symbol having an accepted; a signature.

the constant that is equal to the product of two masses that are attracting each other and divided by the square of the distance between them, which is reckoned as the force of attraction between them; the constant of gravitation.
(phys.) the fact of a mass or particle of matter, including photons, being attracted by every other mass or particle of matter; gravitation.
the natural law that governs the attraction of objects that are free in the space, by the earth; the law of gravitation.

a kind of unleavened, small sweet cake, made by frying in ghee or oil.

a collection of several persons, things, animals, etc. together at a place of time; a crowd, multitude.
